content:
If it is revealed that Pyrrhos was actually ambitious and a hidden Satan all along, it is likely that his actions would have caused destruction and chaos in his world. If Pyrrhos had been actively working against the gods and seeking power for himself, it's possible that he would have manipulated events to lead up to the apocalypse and the final battle at Armageddon.

In this scenario, it's likely that Pyrrhos's ambition and desire for power would have led to his downfall, along with the destruction of his world. The gods may have seen Pyrrhos's true intentions and worked to stop him, possibly even using the apocalypse as a way to cleanse the world of his corrupt influence.

Ultimately, the story of Pyrrhos and his world could serve as a cautionary tale about the dangers of unchecked ambition and the importance of staying true to one's values and principles.
